alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 3:28PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A line of showers along a cold front will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, northwestern Louisa, western Jackson, Cedar, southern Dubuque, Johnson, northern Washington, Jones, southeastern Delaware, western Muscatine, southeastern Linn and northwestern Clinton Counties through 415 PM CST... At 327 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Farley to near Richmond. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 237 and 267. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
